sentences.en: As a peacetime statesman Churchill had been , in his view, something of a disaster.
sentences.cn: 在他看来, 邱吉尔在和平时期是位糟糕的政治家.

sentences.en: But from the air, Berlin still blazed with all its electric lights, as in peacetime.
sentences.cn: 但从天空望下去, 柏林仍然灯火辉煌, 与和平时期一样.

sentences.en: In peacetime, you should also note on bearing lubrication, prevent wear.
sentences.cn: 平时还应注意对轴承的润滑, 防止使用磨损情况发生.

sentences.en: Life in peacetime Britain was grey threadbare dreary and hopeless.
sentences.cn: 和平时期英国的生活是灰色、乏味、沉闷并且无望的.

sentences.en: Like most "peacetime wars" it did not conform to preconceived ideas.
sentences.cn: 如同大多数“和平时代的战争”一样，这与我们的预想不同。

sentences.en: Losing more sweat in peacetime ( training , etc. ) means shedding less blood in war.
sentences.cn: 平时多 流汗, 战时少流血.

sentences.en: Myra: No , we fascination of the'unknown peacetime too.
sentences.cn: 可是, 和平时期我们也会遇到意外的.

sentences.en: Peacetime, It'should be reflecting back to observe things around.
sentences.cn: 平时, 应该静下心来,观察身边的事物.

sentences.en: Secretaries and uniformed orderlies moved softly at a peacetime pace.
sentences.cn: 秘书们和身穿制服的听差们步履轻徐,一如太平年月.

sentences.en: Special forces play an important role in both wartime and peacetime.
sentences.cn: 无论在战时还是平时,特种部队都发挥着重要作用.

sentences.en: The British could afford to reduce defence spending in peacetime without excessive risk.
sentences.cn: 英国可以在和平时期减少国防开支，而不会引来太大风险。

sentences.en: The city itself kept its peacetime look.
sentences.cn: 这座城市本身仍保持着和平时期的样子.

sentences.en: The more you sweat in Peacetime, The less you bleed during War.
sentences.cn: 在和平时付出多, 在战争时流血就少一点.

sentences.en: The wells in peacetime use of the Kwu stamp.
sentences.cn: 此井在平时用石鼓盖上的.

sentences.en: They changed back to peacetime production.
sentences.cn: 他们又回到了和平时期的生产.

sentences.en: We could afford to reduce defence spending in peacetime without excessive risk.
sentences.cn: 在和平时期我们可以减少国防开支而并不引起风险增加。

words.tran_cn: 和平的，爱好和平的；平静的
维护和平的；执行停火协定的

trans.tran_en: a period of time when a country is not fighting a war
